name: bzip2

variants.name: shared
variants.description: Enables the build of shared libraries.

variants.name: debug
variants.description: Enable debug symbols and disable optimization

description:
bzip2 is a freely available, patent free high-quality data compressor.
It typically compresses files to within 10% to 15% of the best available
techniques (the PPM family of statistical compressors), whilst being
around twice as fast at compression and six times faster at
decompression.

dependencies.name: diffutils
dependencies.description:
GNU Diffutils is a package of several programs related to finding
differences between files.

dependent_to.name: bedtools2
dependent_to.description:
Collectively, the bedtools utilities are a swiss-army knife of tools for
a wide-range of genomics analysis tasks. The most widely-used tools
enable genome arithmetic: that is, set theory on the genome.

dependent_to.name: gettext
dependent_to.description: GNU internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n) library.

dependent_to.name: adios
dependent_to.description:
The Adaptable IO System (ADIOS) provides a simple, flexible way for
scientists to describe the data in their code that may need to be
written, read, or processed outside of the running simulation.

dependent_to.name: cfitsio
dependent_to.description:
CFITSIO is a library of C and Fortran subroutines for reading and
writing data files in FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) data
format.

dependent_to.name: paraview
dependent_to.description:
ParaView is an open-source, multi-platform data analysis and
visualization application.

dependent_to.name: htslib
dependent_to.description: C library for high-throughput sequencing data formats.

dependent_to.name: seqan
dependent_to.description:
SeqAn is an open source C++ library of efficient algorithms and data
structures for the analysis of sequences with the focus on biological
data. Our library applies a unique generic design that guarantees high
performance, generality, extensibility, and integration with other
libraries. SeqAn is easy to use and simplifies the development of new
software tools with a minimal loss of performance

dependent_to.name: montage
dependent_to.description:
Montage is a toolkit for assembling Flexible Image Transport System
(FITS) images into custom mosaics.

dependent_to.name: imlib2
dependent_to.description:
Library that does image file loading and saving as well as rendering,
manipulation, arbitrary polygon support

dependent_to.name: ncl
dependent_to.description:
NCL is an interpreted language designed specifically for scientific data
analysis and visualization. Supports NetCDF 3/4, GRIB 1/2, HDF 4/5, HDF-
EOD 2/5, shapefile, ASCII, binary. Numerous analysis functions are
built-in.

dependent_to.name: fox
dependent_to.description:
FOX is a C++ based Toolkit for developing Graphical User Interfaces
easily and effectively. It offers a wide, and growing, collection of
Controls, and provides state of the art facilities such as drag and
drop, selection, as well as OpenGL widgets for 3D graphical
manipulation. FOX also implements icons, images, and user-convenience
features such as status line help, and tooltips. Tooltips may even be
used for 3D objects!

dependent_to.name: mpifileutils
dependent_to.description:
mpiFileUtils is a suite of MPI-based tools to manage large datasets,
which may vary from large directory trees to large files. High-
performance computing users often generate large datasets with parallel
applications that run with many processes (millions in some cases).
However those users are then stuck with single-process tools like cp and
rm to manage their datasets. This suite provides MPI-based tools to
handle typical jobs like copy, remove, and compare for such datasets,
providing speedups of up to 20-30x.

dependent_to.name: cnvnator
dependent_to.description:
A tool for CNV discovery and genotyping from depth-of-coverage by mapped
reads.

dependent_to.name: libarchive
dependent_to.description:
libarchive: C library and command-line tools for reading and writing
tar, cpio, zip, ISO, and other archive formats.

dependent_to.name: eckit
dependent_to.description:
ecKit is a cross-platform c++ toolkit that supports development of tools
and applications at ECMWF.

dependent_to.name: clamav
dependent_to.description:
Open source antivirus engine for detecting trojans, viruses, malware &
other malicious threats.

dependent_to.name: darshan-util
dependent_to.description:
Darshan (util) is collection of tools for parsing and summarizing log
files produced by Darshan (runtime) instrumentation. This package is
typically installed on systems (front-end) where you intend to analyze
log files produced by Darshan (runtime).

dependent_to.name: routino
dependent_to.description:
Routino is an application for finding a route between two points using
the dataset of topographical information collected by
http://www.OpenStreetMap.org.

dependent_to.name: sbml
dependent_to.description: Library for the Systems Biology Markup Language

dependent_to.name: rocksdb
dependent_to.description: RocksDB: A Persistent Key-Value Store for Flash and RAM Storage

dependent_to.name: r-rjava
dependent_to.description:
Low-Level R to Java Interface Low-level interface to Java VM very much
like .C/.Call and friends. Allows creation of objects, calling methods
and accessing fields.

dependent_to.name: lrzip
dependent_to.description:
A compression utility that excels at compressing large files (usually >
10-50 MB). Larger files and/or more free RAM means that the utility will
be able to more effectively compress your files (ie: faster / smaller
size), especially if the filesize(s) exceed 100 MB. You can either
choose to optimise for speed (fast compression / decompression) or size,
but not both.

dependent_to.name: cmake
dependent_to.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependent_to.name: xrootd
dependent_to.description:
The XROOTD project aims at giving high performance, scalable fault
tolerant access to data repositories of many kinds.

dependent_to.name: perl
dependent_to.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.

dependent_to.name: asdf-cxx
dependent_to.description: ASDF - Advanced Scientific Data Format, a C++ implementation

dependent_to.name: boost
dependent_to.description:
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries,
emphasizing libraries that work well with the C++ Standard Library.
Boost libraries are intended to be widely useful, and usable across a
broad spectrum of applications. The Boost license encourages both
commercial and non-commercial use.

dependent_to.name: r
dependent_to.description:
R is 'GNU S', a freely available language and environment for
statistical computing and graphics which provides a wide variety of
statistical and graphical techniques: linear and nonlinear modelling,
statistical tests, time series analysis, classification, clustering,
etc. Please consult the R project homepage for further information.

dependent_to.name: man-db
dependent_to.description:
man-db is an implementation of the standard Unix documentation system
accessed using the man command. It uses a Berkeley DB database in place
of the traditional flat-text whatis databases.

dependent_to.name: piranha
dependent_to.description:
Piranha is a computer-algebra library for the symbolic manipulation of
sparse multivariate polynomials and other closely-related symbolic
objects (such as Poisson series).

dependent_to.name: graphicsmagick
dependent_to.description:
GraphicsMagick is the swiss army knife of image processing. Provides a
robust and efficient collection of tools and libraries which support
reading, writing, and manipulating an image in over 88 major formats
including important formats like DPX, GIF, JPEG, JPEG-2000, PNG, PDF,
PNM, and TIFF.

dependent_to.name: adios2
dependent_to.description:
The Adaptable Input Output System version 2, developed in the Exascale
Computing Program

dependent_to.name: salmon
dependent_to.description:
Salmon is a tool for quantifying the expression of transcripts using
RNA-seq data.

dependent_to.name: amber
dependent_to.description:
Amber is a suite of biomolecular simulation programs together with Amber
tools. A manual download is required for Ambers. Spack will search your
current directory for the download files. Alternatively, add the files
to a mirror so that Spack can find them. For instructions on how to set
up a mirror, see http://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/mirrors.html
Note: Only certain versions of ambertools are compatible with amber.
Only the latter version of ambertools for each amber version is
supported.

dependent_to.name: grass
dependent_to.description:
GRASS GIS (Geographic Resources Analysis Support System), is a free and
open source Geographic Information System (GIS) software suite used for
geospatial data management and analysis, image processing, graphics and
maps production, spatial modeling, and visualization.

dependent_to.name: pandaseq
dependent_to.description:
PANDASEQ is a program to align Illumina reads, optionally with PCR
primers embedded in the sequence, and reconstruct an overlapping
sequence.

dependent_to.name: freetype
dependent_to.description:
FreeType is a freely available software library to render fonts. It is
written in C, designed to be small, efficient, highly customizable, and
portable while capable of producing high-quality output (glyph images)
of most vector and bitmap font formats.

dependent_to.name: shapeit4
dependent_to.description:
SHAPEIT4 is a fast and accurate method for estimation of haplotypes (aka
phasing) for SNP array and high coverage sequencing data.

dependent_to.name: reditools
dependent_to.description:
REDItools: python scripts for RNA editing detection by RNA-Seq data.
REDItools are simple python scripts conceived to facilitate the
investigation of RNA editing at large-scale and devoted to research
groups that would to explore such phenomenon in own data but don't have
sufficient bioinformatics skills. They work on main operating systems
(although unix/linux-based OS are preferred), can handle reads from
whatever platform in the standard BAM format and implement a variety of
filters.

dependent_to.name: spades
dependent_to.description:
SPAdes - St. Petersburg genome assembler - is intended for both standard
isolates and single-cell MDA bacteria assemblies.

dependent_to.name: elfutils
dependent_to.description:
elfutils is a collection of various binary tools such as eu-objdump, eu-
readelf, and other utilities that allow you to inspect and manipulate
ELF files. Refer to Table 5.Tools Included in elfutils for Red Hat
Developer for a complete list of binary tools that are distributed with
the Red Hat Developer Toolset version of elfutils.

dependent_to.name: ncbi-toolkit
dependent_to.description: NCBI C++ Toolkit

dependent_to.name: gmap-gsnap
dependent_to.description:
GMAP: A Genomic Mapping and Alignment Program for mRNA and EST
Sequences, and GSNAP: Genomic Short-read Nucleotide Alignment Program

dependent_to.name: miopen-hip
dependent_to.description: AMD's library for high performance machine learning primitives.

dependent_to.name: bgpdump
dependent_to.description: Utility and C Library for parsing MRT files

dependent_to.name: libhio
dependent_to.description:
libHIO is a flexible, high-performance parallel IO package developed at
LANL. libHIO supports IO to either a conventional PFS or to Cray
DataWarp with management of Cray DataWarp space and stage-in and stage-
out from and to the PFS.

dependent_to.name: xterm
dependent_to.description:
The xterm program is a terminal emulator for the X Window System. It
provides DEC VT102 and Tektronix 4014 compatible terminals for programs
that can't use the window system directly.

dependent_to.name: munge
dependent_to.description: MUNGE Uid 'N' Gid Emporium

dependent_to.name: strelka
dependent_to.description: Somatic and germline small variant caller for mapped sequencing data.

dependent_to.name: nix
dependent_to.description: Nix, the purely functional package manager

dependent_to.name: python
dependent_to.description: The Python programming language.

dependent_to.name: dealii
dependent_to.description:
C++ software library providing well-documented tools to build finite
element codes for a broad variety of PDEs.

dependent_to.name: zip
dependent_to.description: Zip is a compression and file packaging/archive utility.

dependent_to.name: blast-plus
dependent_to.description: Basic Local Alignment Search Tool.

dependent_to.name: miopen-opencl
dependent_to.description: AMD's library for high performance machine learning primitives.

dependent_to.name: perl-compress-raw-bzip2
dependent_to.description: A low-Level Interface to bzip2 compression library.

dependent_to.name: rpm
dependent_to.description:
The RPM package manager https://github.com/rpm-software-
management/rpm/blob/master/INSTALL Note that debugedit is an additional
tool that *should* compile with adding libdw and elfutils, but the
library (as of 4.16.1.2) is being removed from rpm and will be put
somewhere else.

dependent_to.name: r-rhtslib
dependent_to.description:
HTSlib high-throughput sequencing library as an R package This package
provides version 1.7 of the 'HTSlib' C library for high- throughput
sequence analysis. The package is primarily useful to developers of
other R packages who wish to make use of HTSlib. Motivation and
instructions for use of this package are in the vignette,
vignette(package="Rhtslib", "Rhtslib").

dependent_to.name: py-tables
dependent_to.description:
PyTables is a package for managing hierarchical datasets and designed to
efficiently and easily cope with extremely large amounts of data.

dependent_to.name: sox
dependent_to.description: SoX, the Swiss Army knife of sound processing programs.

dependent_to.name: hpctoolkit
dependent_to.description:
HPCToolkit is an integrated suite of tools for measurement and analysis
of program performance on computers ranging from multicore desktop
systems to the nation's largest supercomputers. By using statistical
sampling of timers and hardware performance counters, HPCToolkit
collects accurate measurements of a program's work, resource
consumption, and inefficiency and attributes them to the full calling
context in which they occur.

dependent_to.name: ffmpeg
dependent_to.description:
FFmpeg is a complete, cross-platform solution to record, convert and
stream audio and video.
